data.name: AllowPortsTooltip
data.value: Comma separated ports or port ranges to always allow, regardless of country blocking - i.e. 80, 443.

data.name: BanCount
data.comment: Total number of bans / lock outs

data.name: BanTimeTooltip
data.value: The duration of time to ban an ip address. Format is DD:HH:MM:SS. Use 00:00:00:00 for max ban duration (90 days). Must be at least one minute.

data.name: BaseUrl
data.comment: The base url for a site, i.e. http://www.ipban.com

data.name: BaseUrlTooltip
data.value: The base url of the server to connect clients to, should be this server

data.name: City
data.comment: A city, i.e. New York City

data.name: ClearBannedIPAddressesOnRestartTooltip
data.value: True to clear and unban all the ip addresses from the firewall upon restart, false otherwise

data.name: ClientConfiguration
data.comment: Change the configuration of a client machine

data.name: ClientConfigurationOverrideTooltip
data.value: Replace global configuration values for this client

data.name: CountryBlacklistIntervalTooltip
data.value: 24 hour start (local time), day of month to send out country blacklist to clients, i.e. 3,28

data.name: CountryBlacklistTooltip
data.value: Select banned countries. The firewall will be updated with the first failed login from an ip address in the range of any blocked country, excluding any whitelisted ip addresses.

data.name: CreateWhitelistFirewallRuleTooltip
data.value: Whether to create a whitelist firewall rule. This gives all whitelist ip access to all ports

data.name: CycleTimeTooltip
data.value: The time between cycles to do house-keeping such as un-banning ip addresses, reloading config, etc. Will be clamped between 5 and 60 seconds. Format is DD:HH:MM:SS.

data.name: Delete
data.comment: Delete some data from the database

data.name: EditMachine
data.comment: Edit machine user name and password

data.name: EnableSSL
data.comment: Whether to enable ssl (i.e. https instead of http)

data.name: EnableSSLTooltip
data.value: Whether to enable SSL (secure socket layer) immediately on connection. Leave false to auto-detect.

data.name: ExpireTimeTooltip
data.value: The duration after the last failed login attempt that the ip is forgotten(count reset back to 0). Set to 00:00:00:00 to use max duration (90 days). Format is DD:HH:MM:SS.

data.name: FailedLoginAttemptsBeforeBanTooltip
data.value: Number of failed logins before banning an ip address

data.name: FailedLoginsBeforeBanUserNameWhitelistTooltip
data.value: Number of failed logins before banning the ip address if the user name is in the user name whitelist

data.name: FirewallRulePrefixTooltip
data.value: Rule prefix name for firewall rules, must contain only A-Z, 0-9 and _

data.name: FQDN
data.comment: Fully qualified domain name, keep short

data.name: IPBanShield
data.comment: Shield like a knight would use

data.name: IPBlacklistRegexTooltip
data.value: Regular expression for more advanced blacklisting. Shortcut: use* to allow any piece of an ip, dns name, url or user name(i.e. 128.128.128.*). Sample regex that blacklists a few ips: ^(128\.128\.128\.*)|(99\.99\.99\.[0-9])$ More info about regex: http://www.regular-expressions.info/

data.name: IPBlacklistTooltip
data.value: IP addresses, cidr masks, dns names or user names to always ban and never unban. Prefix user names with user:, i.e. user:root.

data.name: IPWhitelistRegexTooltip
data.value: Regular expression for more advanced whitelisting. Shortcut: use * to allow any piece of an ip (i.e. 128.128.128.*). Sample regex that whitelists a few ips: ^(128\.128\.128\.*)|(99\.99\.99\.[0-9])$ More info about regex: http://www.regular-expressions.info/

data.name: IPWhitelistTooltip
data.value: IP addresses, cidr masks, urls or dns names to never ban. Prefis user names with user:, i.e. user:root.

data.name: LastUpdate
data.comment: The last update (date/time) of the software

data.name: LogParsing
data.comment: Like log file parsing, Windows event viewer, etc.

data.name: MachineWhitelist
data.comment: Allowed ip addresses for a specific machine

data.name: MaxActiveBlacklistedIPAddressesTooltip
data.value: The maximum blacklisted ip addresses to return, in order of last seen date descending

data.name: MinimumTimeBetweenFailedLoginAttemptsTooltip
data.value: The minimum time between failed login attempts for an ip address to increment the ban counter. Format is DD:HH:MM:SS. Will be clamped to 0 and 15 seconds.

data.name: MinimumTrustLevelTooltip
data.value: Minimum trust level for recent banned ip sharing (0-10) where 0 is trust all submissions

data.name: NaughtyListCountTooltip
data.value: Naughty list max count, set to 0 to disable

data.name: PrivateAPIKeyTooltip
data.value: Your IPBan Pro Private API Key

data.name: ProcessToRunOnBanTooltip
data.value: Run an external process when a ban occurs. Separate the process and any arguments with a pipe (|). ###IPADDRESS### will be replaced with the actual IP which was banned. The pipe is required. Example: c:\system\files\on_ip_banned.exe|###IPADDRESS### -q

data.name: PublicAPIKeyTooltip
data.value: Your IPBan Pro Public API Key

data.name: RecentActivity
data.comment: Recent activity, i.e. the most recent ip addresses that have been banned

data.name: RecentListCountTooltip
data.value: Recent list max count, set to 0 to disable

data.name: Region
data.comment: A region in a country, i.e. Quebec, Canada

data.name: RemoteHost
data.comment: Remote host (dns name or internet provider name, etc.)

data.name: SiteLink
data.comment: Do not change, keep exactly as is

data.name: SmtpBodyTemplateTooltip
data.value: Body template for sent mail. {0} = machine name, {1} = user name, {2} = local ip address, {3} = remote ip address, {4} = remote host name, {5} = city, {6} = region, {7} = country, {8} = event type, {9} = source.

data.name: SmtpFromTooltip
data.value: Smtp user to send mail as (i.e. bob@hotmail.com)

data.name: SmtpSubjectTemplateTooltip
data.value: Subject template for sent mail. {0} = machine name, {1} = user name, {2} = local ip address, {3} = remote ip address, {4} = remote host name, {5} = city, {6} = region, {7} = country, {8} = event type, {9} = source.

data.name: SmtpToTooltip
data.value: Comma separated list of users to send mail to

data.name: SmtpWhoisBodyTemplateTooltip
data.value: Body template for emailing abuse email addresses. {0} = banned ip address, {1} = banned host name, {2} = log of failed attempts.

data.name: SmtpWhoisSubjectTemplateTooltip
data.value: Subject template for emailing abuse email addresses. {0} = banned ip address, {1} = banned host name, {2} = external ip address of machine that banned the ip address, {3} = machine name, {4} = machine ip address.

data.name: Success
data.comment: i.e., the result of the operation was a success

data.name: Timestamp
data.comment: A timestamp, i.e. date / time of an event

data.name: UnexpectedError
data.value: An unexpected error has ocurred. Please email support@ipban.com for help.

data.name: UserNameWhitelistMinimumEditDistanceTooltip
data.value: If user name whitelist is not empty and if the edit distance (levenshtein distance) of a failed user name is greater than this distance away, the user name is immediately banned. Set to 0 to ban all failed user names if UserNameWhitelist has entries. Case is ignored. Empty user names are always allowed.

data.name: UserNameWhitelistTooltip
data.value: Comma separated list of user names that are allowed. UserNameWhitelistMinimumEditDistance is checked for user names not in the list to determine whether a failed user name should be banned. Case is ignored. Empty user names are always allowed. *** IMPORTANT*** This can represent an attack vector by a hacker. If they know you are using IPBan and they don't get locked out right away, they might know they are somewhat close to the right user name. Make sure your passwords are complex enough and this shouldn't be a problem.

data.name: EventViewerExpressionsTooltip
data.value: Event viewer expressions to find. Format is //XPath[newline]Regex. Regex can span multiple lines. Start a new XPath to search for by putting //XPath on a new line.

data.name: FailedLoginRegexTooltip
data.value: Regex to parse failed logins out of log files. Please provide ipaddress and username groups.

data.name: MaxFileSizeTooltip
data.value: The max size to let the file grow to before deleting it and starting over, in bytes

data.name: NotifyOnlyTooltip
data.value: Whether this is a notification of a successful login (true) or a failed login (false)

data.name: PathAndMaskTooltip
data.value: Paths and masks to search, one per line. Glob syntax can be used for recursion, i.e. /logs/**/*.log

data.name: LogFilePingIntervalTooltip
data.value: How often to ping the log file, in milliseconds

data.name: PlatformRegexTooltip
data.value: The regex to filter based on current platform, i.e. Windows or Linux.

data.name: SuccessfulLoginRegexTooltip
data.value: Regex to parse succesful logins out of log files. Please provide ipaddress and username groups.

data.name: XPathRegexTooltip
data.value: Regex to find in the xpath, please provide ipaddress and username groups.

data.name: SourceTooltip
data.value: The event source, i.e. RDP, SSH, SMTP, etc.

data.name: EventViewerPathTooltip
data.value: The event viewer path, i.e. Application or Security, etc.

data.name: UseDefaultBannedIPAddressHandler
data.value: Use Default Banned IP Address Handler

data.name: UseDefaultBannedIPAddressHandlerTooltip
data.value: Whether to use the default banned ip address handler. Turn off to disable default handling such as sharing anonymously the banned ip address to the global banned ip address database.

data.name: CountryListEntryCount
data.value: {0} ranges in the country block list

data.name: NaughtyListEntryCount
data.value: {0} ip addresses in the naughty list

data.name: RecentListEntryCount
data.value: {0} ip addresses in the recent list

data.name: UsernameOrPasswordIsBlank
data.value: User name or password is empty

data.name: ResetFailedLoginCountForUnbannedIPAddresses
data.value: Reset Failed Login Count on Unban

data.name: Details
data.comment: Details of an ip address such as city, country, etc.

data.name: FirewallRulesTooltip
data.value: Extra firewall rules, one per line. Great way to persist firewall rules. Format is 'rule-name;allow or block;ip list (comma spearated);allowed port list (comma separated);platform regex'. The name should be kept to 16 or less chars.

data.name: UserNameWhitelistRegexTooltip
data.value: If set, any user name that fails this regex will result in an immediate ban of the ip address.

data.name: FirewallUriRulesTooltip
data.value: Config entry for firewall uri rules, one per line. Format is RulePrefix,Interval(DD:HH:MM:SS),Uri[NEWLINE].

data.name: FailedLoginRegexTimestampFormatTooltip
data.value: Format for timestamp if failed login regex has a timestamp group

data.name: SuccessfulLoginRegexTimestampFormatTooltip
data.value: Format for timestamp if successful login regex has a timestamp group

data.name: Update
data.comment: As in update the software to latest version

data.name: UpdateClients
data.comment: As in update clients to the latest software version

data.name: EnableListsTooltip
data.value: Whether to enable lists like the recent or naughty list

data.name: FailedLoginThresholdTooltip
data.value: Override the failed login threshold or 0 for default

data.name: ProcessToRunOnUnbanTooltip
data.value: Run an external process when a ban is removed. Separate the process and any arguments with a pipe (|). ###IPADDRESS### will be replaced with the actual IP which was unbanned. The pipe is required. Example: c:\system\files\on_ip_unbanned.exe|###IPADDRESS### -q

data.name: EnterLicenseKeys
data.value: Enter license keys, one per line

data.name: RemoveAllLicenseKeys
data.value: Remove all license keys and reset usage.

data.name: Guest
data.comment: A guest user of the software

data.name: Role
data.comment: Role of current user, i.e. guest or admin, etc.

data.name: NotificationWebHookTooltip
data.value: POST a JSON object to an end point for every notification. Contains Subject, Body and ToAddresses fields.

data.name: AllowedPortsTooltip
data.value: Allowed port/port-ranges (comma separated). Empty to not allow any ports. Example: 80, 443, 500-510. Only supported on WinDivert and WFP firewalls.

data.name: CountryBlacklistFirstFailedLoginTooltip
data.value: Whether to wait until first failed login from a bad country before banning (checked) or to pro-actively add the entire country to the firewall if possible (unchecked). If checked, allowed ports is ignored.

data.name: CredentialPropagation
data.value: Any changes made to the administrator account will propagate to clients automatically.

data.name: ProcessInternalIPAddressesTooltip
data.value: Whether to process internal ip addresses
